page.title: 17HISTORY OF STRETTON SCHOOLS
page.content: Church Stretton's old school used to be where the library is now. It was built in{1860}and opened in{1861.}It cost Â£1055 to build. In{1940}all the infants aged from five to seven moved to the parish hall because of lack of space in the existing building. In{1948}Hope Bowdler school and Acton Scott school closed down, considerably increasing numbers at Church Stretton. Then the children over ten (the seniors) were moved to the St. Dunstan's huts in Essex Road. In{1960}the new Secondary Modern opened up in Shrewsbury Road for the seniors. In{1968}the old school closed. The children moved to a new primary school (our school) in Shrewsbury Road which was opened on{May 7th 1968.
